author: {'steamid': '76561198042475731', 'num_games_owned': 939, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1709847606}
review:
"Morphine" presents an experience that can be quite jumpy, though the scares are mostly reliant on loud sound effects rather than visual frights. Unfortunately, some tasks, like lock picking, feel needlessly drawn out due to reliance on RNG mechanics. The game's menu can also be frustratingly buggy, particularly when adjusting to different resolutions. Animations throughout the game leave much to be desired, lacking polish and fluidity.

One helpful feature is a guiding green light, yet its effectiveness wavers, leaving players confused at times. As the game progresses, expect to encounter excessively long cut scenes that feel unnecessarily prolonged, often taking away from the gameplay's momentum.

Overall, "Morphine" fails to impress, and it's perplexing why it garners numerous positive reviews. The game tends to lean towards boredom rather than delivering engaging gameplay or compelling scares, making it difficult to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1705775062}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561199174853497', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1682346392}
review:
This game is a "must play".  It's very indicative of our current society, especially in the western nations, and all of us need a reminder of what it's like to walk in somebody else's shoes.

You are Peter, a high school boy who is a loser.  He can't swim, fish, fight, be on time, or seemingly do much of anything else.  At home, his dad calls him worthless, and makes him occasionally sleep in the barn.  His mom didn't even want him to begin with.

At school, he's bullied by Ted, and as we all know in RL, the nearby crowd will giggle, mock, and go along.  They are okay with bullying as long as [b]they[/b] aren't the victim of it.  Even the teachers come down on him disproportionately.  Eventually, Peter mentally breaks down and the unthinkable happens.

The game plays like a surreal and disturbing nightmare of everyday events in Peter's life.  Plus, there's also this demonic rabbit who haunts and taunts him.  You walk through the different scenarios, solving some puzzles and completing some tasks.

Achievements are fairly easy, but you [b]will[/b] need to look at the Walkthrough Guide to get a certain one, because it can only be gotten when you play a very small but specific section of the game in it's original Turkish language.  Speaking of Turkish, the English translation isn't that good with spelling and grammar, but you can figure out what is going on anyway.

Graphics are decent for an indie game from 2015.  Controls are simple.  The usual 'WASD' for movement and 'F' for interacting with an object.  Lot of demonic whispering and giggling.  Kind of unnerving at first, but it happens so often it eventually just becomes annoying.

There's a couple of loud jumpscares, as you would expect.  [b]SEIZURE WARNING:[/b]  There's also a couple of instances of flashing/strobing lights, but they don't last long.  Depending on your pace of play, the game should take 2 to 3 hours to finish and get all the achievements.  Since it's a story, however, there is no replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300153428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 1072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1662073947}
review:
I'm not a gaming expert by any means and I may not use correct terminology, but I'll do my best. 
This is a cheap, short game. I paid under 70 cents for it on sale. It took me longer to play due to my computer  issues. It has a lot of waste space, and the mechanics are not great.  However, I feel it was made by the Dev because he had something he wanted to say. He writes that in a letter after the game. By the way, don't leave at the credits, there is a wrap up to follow which is worth seeing. It's a little confusing, definitely strange, but oddly compelling. The message is very relevant now, as it was when he made the game.  It has a few jump scares that don't. ( Scare, that is.) There is little shooting so FPS doesn't mean what it typically does.  The graphics are rather primitive, but that doesn't seem to matter once you get into the story. I got put off a few times and could have dumped it since it was cheap, but the story kept me interested.  It was made to send a message, which it does, and IMHO, is worth a play, if you have a couple of hours for a disturbing trip with a crazy, or evil, "wabbit"....Bye the way, the English is poor and a lot of things could be improved but I did not consider those details as important as the story itself, the Dev is foreign and should had polished it up, but I've played big games that have obvious sloppy bits too, big deal.  There does seem to be name confusion at the end.  Anyway, the story is the same.
Having played it again, I think the basic storyline is more clear.  It's the not uncommon story of a boy, bullied by his father, other kids, etc. and can't take it anymore. A lot of us know what that feels like, at any age. When he reaches that point his dark side, in the form of a rabbit, starts to come out and take over, eventually leading him to do a terrible thing. I think it's called Morphine because his actions are all he can do to ease his pain.  A very good game by a single dev who apparently worked on it for some years. I thank him.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996109111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1635133285}
review:
I literally hate this game.  I sat down and beat it in a single sitting and I went from finding it hilarious to finding it completely goddamned offensive by the end.  The first and apparently only game by the developer, some guy from Turkey who was apparently dealing with pent up feelings after being bullied in school, Morphine lives up to its name in that I now want to overdose on it and die to escape the soiled feeling clinging to my soul after having played it.

You play as a sad sack named Peter who is being haunted by a pink definitely not Donnie Darko rabbit and the phrase "I'm not a loser" whose life is literally nothing but misery as literally everyone, even his own parents, hate him with a passion.  The entire story is a disjointed series of flashbacks broken up by sequences in which he wanders the halls of the school with weird, random shit happening in them.  Ostensibly, some of this presentation is supposed to be frightening in some way, but it's surreal at best and comical at worst.

We find out that literally everyone in the school gives him shit, his father locks him in the barn at night for getting a B on a test, and his own mother writes a scathing passage in her diary where she says she never felt like he was her son and she regrets having him and doesn't love him.  All the while, he keeps saying he is going to get revenge on Ted, the bully who is making his life miserable.  To make matters worse, a cute girl shows up and is actually willing to talk to him, but the bully forces him to pretend he doesn't want to be friends.  If you haven't already guessed it, let me spoil the ending for you: he gets a gun and kills both the bully and the girl for being his friend and not his.

Not only is this pushing the verifiably untrue narrative of the bullied kid as the school shooter (statistics show that the majority of school shooters are NOT social outcasts, despite the media constantly trying to frame it that way) but the story is riddled with nonsensical plot twists that are literally never explained and also have no impact on anything.  At one point we see Peter has a friend named Jane who sometimes cares about him, but later it's implied but not confirmed that she maybe isn't even real, which is fine because she barely added anything to the plot.  Later, we get the bigger twist that--gasp--Peter is actually named Ted and Ted is actually named Peter!  Again, this... this literally does nothing for the story.  This reveal comes just before Ted shoots Peter and Amy and does nothing except make you wonder if the dev took a break before the end and then came back and forgot who was who.   Then he chases the rabbit to the roof and, in another brilliant twist, we discover the rabbit just represents Peter himself and when he shoots it he dies.

There is a post credits sequence that assumedly is meant to clear up some of the confusion about the elements present in the end of the game in which the police go over the security footage from the school, but it provides LITERALLY NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION beyond the moronic addition of Ted's last name: Bundy.  Yes, seriously, the dev named the main character we are meant to sympathize with after an infamous serial killer.  The police literally do nothing beyond recapping the game's ending and, after seeing him shoot at nothing and dive off the roof, loudly proclaim that the FBI needs to be involved because of yet more nonsensical and inexplicable reasons.  Perhaps the biggest twist of all comes in that Ted somehow survived and is handcuffed to a hospital bed.  The doctor tells a nurse to get him if he wakes up and... that's it.  The End.  Fuck you for playing.

I cannot stress how much I hate this game after playing it.  As somebody who dealt with being bullied in school, this game feels like somebody attempting to validate every concerned parent's claim that I was going to be the next school shooter.  Not only that, but they tried to make this point in such a confusing and stupid way that it started out funny and quickly wrapped around to just plain infuriating.  With every fiber of my being, I wish ill will upon the dev of this game and I sincerely hope that he stubs his toe very badly or drops his favorite novelty drinking glass on the floor and it breaks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053229942', 'num_games_owned': 1399, 'num_reviews': 1091, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1624964537}
review:
It's one of these games which are so bad they end up being somewhat entertaining, but not a lot.

The story is hilarious, the player plays as a complete moron and a loser who is socially completely inept. The events are a mix of his dreams and what he has done. It's a linear walking simulator with choices only at the final chapter of the story, and one of the endings lets you become a school shooter!

Gameplay though is really poor. The player only walks through linear corridors and clicks when the game tells him to. What's worse, the game suggests that you can interact with many objects, mostly doors, but clicking on them gives no feedback whatsoever.

The game uses broken English, which is mostly understandable except when the game asks you to find two items.
When it asks to find bushes, you need to find twigs.
When it asks to find a buckle you need to find a hairpin.

Note that the ending cutscene is after credits. I'll add that the developer himself admitted in the credits to be mentally unstable, socially inept and that he was bullied in multiple schools, which made him leave them :D

If you can get it for a low price on a sale (about $1 now) you might spend 90 minutes mildly entertained, but only if you can enjoy budget walking simulators. Otherwise do not bother.

review:
[h3]Morphine[/h3]
[u]Erste-Sicht-Abenteuer oder nur Laufsimulator ?[/u]

Ein nicht endender Albtraum scheint das Leben des Protagonisten zu sein. In surrealen Szenen wird erzÃ¤hlt, wie ein Loser versucht, sich gegen das GefÃ¼hl zu wehren, ein Niemand zu sein, der sich nichts zutraut.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2505721339
Kann er sich am Ende behaupten ? Und was bedeutet der immer wieder auftretende Hase ? Wenn ihr es wissen wollt, dann besorgt euch dieses fÃ¼rchterliche Machwerk und spielt es durch. 

Der Entwickler hat sich zwar MÃ¼he gegeben, alles schÃ¶n aussehen zu lassen und mir hat es auch irgendwo gefallen, aber das Spiel ist irgendwie arm an echter Handlung auÃŸer Miniaktionen, es gibt keine echte Herausforderung, es ist halt Ã¼berwiegend eine Laufsim.

Bisher ist mir aus tÃ¼rkischen "Studios" noch nichts Gutes unter die Finger geraten, das hier gehÃ¶rt auch zu den Spielen, die man lieber vergessen sollte.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979935067', 'num_games_owned': 2559, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1615017749}
review:
is the game half missing off the screen? unable to see the settings? screwed up resolution?
heres how i fixed it (for me anyways). 
find the game folder in your steam files (Steam\steamapps\common\Morphine)
right click morphinegame.exe and go to properties
click Compatibility tab
near bottom click Change high DPI settings button
near bottom again where it says High DPI scaling override, check the box and set scaling performed by: to System
and it should work for you now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098605947', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1610790291}
review:
For an indie horror game 8/10 
(loses points for poorly translated English dialogue and other knit-picking)

I bought this expecting to get a laughable horror game. While some of the animations did end up being pretty funny, the story is pretty good for what it is. The single dev obviously put his heart into the story. Also, the art and music is good. 

Worthy to check out if you have a couple dollars to spare.

UPDATE: 
I played this game a second time and I wanted to note something that all the negative reviews don't seem to realize: the dev is an excellent visual story teller. The dev did a great job and using lighting to help the player complete puzzles. Also, there are some other subtle sounds and visual queues that are worth noting but I won't tell because they spoil the story.

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/43582006-Tooth-Brushers]My curator page[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198037429842', 'num_games_owned': 4858, 'num_reviews': 576, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1599587382}
review:
Sehr sehr sehr seltsames Indie Horror Game, die erste Stunde verlÃ¤uft sehr trashig mit vielen Jumpscares, random Traumsequenzen und viel zu lauten Stock-sound-effekten - Dann auf einmal wandelt es sich in eine extrem dÃ¼stere AmoklÃ¤uferstory und der overall tone des Games nimmt eine extrem finstere Wendung. 
Ich bin allgemein ein Fan von Horrorgames die extrem darke Themen und Stories benutzen, ein wenig Props muss ich hier also trotzdem geben, auch wenn 90% des Games wie Zusammenhangslose Horror-cliches wirken.

Englischer Text ist zu 50% komplett daneben, der Hase wirkt wie eine random Donnie Darko Kopie und Horror gibt es quasi keinen, es entsteht aber eine leichte surreale Erfahrung, die aber leider sehr viele andere Indie Horror Games weitaus besser hinbekommen.

3/10

Full Game + Analyse: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PEAxkt85lJc&lc=UgyCLp7CI6N9_WeZHvt4AaABAg&ab_channel=Corrupted

author: {'steamid': '76561198274438291', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1589424804}
review:
This game is not terrible, and I applaud the dev for a decent effort. The game handles alright for the most part, and I really want to recommend it, but there are two huge dealbreakers:

-The translation of pronouns is frequently incorrect. which turns some messages into nonsense. This, on top of the dev getting the names of his own characters mixed up, makes a number of messages incomprehensible. I don't mind bad translations if I can understand what's being said, but I shouldn't have to reread a note several times to piece together its simple meaning. 
-There are too many technical glitches. I spent as much time messing with the game's files in order to make one of the achievements achievable as I did playing the game. That should not have been necessary. That's my biggest complaint among numerous other glitches. 

ps. The main character IS a loser.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103319801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1584131543}
review:
[h1] Morphine: interessante idea, pessima realizzazione [/h1]

[i] Morphine [/i] Ã¨ un indie horror che narra le vicende di Peter, un ragazzo emaciato, goffo e insicuro, che Ã¨ perpetuamente bullizzato dai compagni di classe, in particolar modo da Ted, e mortificato tenacemente dalla famiglia. Tali ostinate umiliazioni sono il terreno fertile per intraprendere un viaggio psichedelico nella mente devastata di Peter. Questo percorso perturbante ha come principale protagonista un coniglio rosa antropomorfo, che ricorda terribilmente Frank, del film â€œDonnie Darkoâ€, che, a differenza di questâ€™ultimo, ha un atteggiamento sadico e talvolta nonsense/comico, piuttosto che esistenzialista come nel film. 
La storia Ã¨ abbastanza interessante ed Ã¨ narrata in maniera quasi decente, tuttavia il comparto tecnico fa acqua da tutte le parti: bug e glitch ovunque e grafica non curata. Le mie aspettative non erano esagerate ed ero ben disposta a chiudere un occhio, visto il prezzo irrisorio. Il problema inizia a sorgere quando Morphine diviene ingiocabile e necessita di un restart, perchÃ© magari i comandi non rispondono, câ€™Ã¨ un black screen, oppure sei catapultato in una realtÃ  diversa da quella stabilita dal gioco e il protagonista non puÃ² muoversi in nessuna direzione. Insomma, diviene frustrante, persino per un gioco che hai pagato poche decine di centesimi. Nel complesso lâ€™opera appare un prodotto rozzo, grezzo. Lâ€™idea alla base Ã¨ particolarmente interessante, ma il lavoro complessivo Ã¨ troppo raffazzonato: avrebbe potuto essere potenzialmente unâ€™opera alla Egon Schiele, alla Franz Kafka, invece si riduce ad essere un giochino a tratti frustrante perchÃ© i comandi non rispondono, con una trama interessante ma non spiegata adeguatamente. Potenzialmente avrebbe potuto essere un profondo horror psicologico, concretamente non lo Ã¨. Concretamente vale i soldi per cui ho speso, ed Ã¨ lâ€™unica ragione per cui, nel bene e nel male, lo consiglio, anche se con riserva. Ci sono troppi buchi di trama, troppi errori, non solo tecnici, ma anche concettuali. Anzitutto, perchÃ© câ€™Ã¨ scritto che Ã¨ un FPS nella descrizione del gioco? Ma dove? Ma in quale galassia e in quale universo? Il gameplay Ã¨ ridotto allâ€™osso con i classici WASD per muoversi e giusto il tasto F per interagire con i pochissimi oggetti con cui si puÃ² interagire: definirlo minimale Ã¨ poco. Il gioco Ã¨ macchinoso, non fluido e si gioca con la paura che qualche errore di programmazione possa vanificarti la partita. Ma poi, vi sono errori grammaticali in inglese molto sciocchi e una confusione nei nomi non giustificabile. Sappiamo che Peter Ã¨ il protagonista e Ted Ã¨ lâ€™antagonista; entrambi fanno molto clichÃ© americano come aspetto estetico e modalitÃ  di interazione bullo/vittima, ma va bene. Verso la fine del gioco câ€™Ã¨ uno switch dei nomi. Inizialmente si puÃ² pensare persino ad una svolta psichedelica, stile Far Cry 3 â€œyou are me and I am youâ€, ma sarebbe stata una mossa troppo profonda per un gioco che Ã¨ poco rifinito, incompleto e grossolano. Ãˆ semplicemente un errore di distrazione, lâ€™ennesimo di tanti. 
Inoltre, ho trovato le, uhm, â€œcutsceneâ€ di una lentezza ammorbante. Non essendoci un doppiaggio (a mio avviso necessario), un minimo di movimento e non avendo la possibilitÃ  di skippare i dialoghi, stavo lÃ¬ ad aspettare la fine di una cutscene che mi sembrava cosÃ¬ interminabile che, con quel tempo a disposizione, avrei potuto andare a fare il caffÃ¨ e pulire pure la tazzina. Ribadisco, non mi aspettavo chissÃ  quale rifinitura, perÃ² tutti questi difetti nel complesso sono difficili da digerire ed Ã¨ difficile godersi il videogioco. Inoltre, credo che il tema del bullying non sia stato gestito in maniera corretta. Nel gioco la frase â€œIâ€™m not a loserâ€ (non sono un perdente) compare ovunque al punto da desensibilizzarti notevolmente sulla causa perorata da Peter. Forse lâ€™ossessione nei confronti di questo nomignolo -loser- Ã¨ la scintilla che ha fatto scoccare la psicosi del protagonista, ma calmati bro, abbiamo capito. 
Unâ€™altra cosa che mi ha fatto storcere il naso Ã¨ il titolo stesso: Morphine, titolo del tutto fuorviante, a mio parere. La morfina Ã¨ un alcaloide contenuto nellâ€™oppio che ha un effetto analgesico, dunque anestetizza il dolore, ti rende piÃ¹ docile, mentre nel videogioco viene comparato ad un allucinogeno, ad un eccitante, tipo LSD o cocaina. Lâ€™errore sta giÃ  nel titolo e questo la dice lunga sul risultato raffazzonato.

[b] Pro del gioco: [/b] 
+ Costo irrisorio
+ Trama discreta
+ Abbastanza spaventoso, câ€™Ã¨ stato qualche jumpscare iniziale, soprattutto se si gioca con le cuffie ad alto volume
+ I rimandi costanti a Donnie Darko con trip psichedelici quasi comici: alla fine quel coniglio diventa praticamente un bestie visto che Ã¨ onnipresente
+ Atmosfera disturbante
[b] Contro del gioco: [/b] 
- Pieno di bug, programmato male, con una quantitÃ  notevole di errori tecnici 
- Errori piuttosto impietosi nella traduzione inglese
- Mancanza di doppiaggio e lentezza delle â€œcutsceneâ€, parecchio tediose

[b] Consiglieresti questo gioco? [/b] 
Ãˆ un ni. Oggettivamente no, soggettivamente sÃ¬. Propendo di piÃ¹ verso il sÃ¬ solo perchÃ© il costo Ã¨ veramente irrisorio, per cui lâ€™asticella delle aspettative deve essere relazionata al costo effettivo del prodotto. E inoltre io amo i trip mentali e i conigli, soprattutto quelli creepy. Ce la fa per il rotto della cuffia. 
[u] 5.8/10 [/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561198154757644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1574158397}
review:
Well, that was unexpected.
The first 20 minutes or so and I was thinking this is going to be another one of those card farming games only, but then once I got through a horrendous dark corridor with a tiny spotlight, the story grew on me and by the latter stages I was fully engaged in. 
This is such a trippy and dark game, but ultimately very satisfying. 
Definitely worth 2 and a half hours of your time for an evening playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202047905', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1562272656}
review:
First of all, I'd like to point out the fact that I admire the developer because he made this game on his own and I really think he made a good job with this psychedelic horror game. Also, the details such as MalkaÃ§oÄŸlu and "the walking plane" were very amusing and they also let the players take a moment and relax a bit from all the thrill that was going with the game. However, there are also some mistakes that cannot be ignored at the same time. For example:
- There are some huge grammar mistakes in the English version of the game.
- There seems to be no connection to why Ted's and Peter's name exchange. I know it is the psychedelic effect, but it creates so many questions such as "Do they forget who they are?" or "Was the protagonist referring to himself while saying "I hate you Ted." in the diary?" To cut it short, the point's not clear.
- There are some serious optimization errors that slow the computer down and make it hard for the players to play the game.

Apart from that, I would recommend this game. It was a thrilling and enjoyable experience for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972001997', 'num_games_owned': 1520, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1537048163}
review:
Could have been good shorter game, but technical problems kill it. Ending is not really surprising (at least for those who encountered even mild bullying).

Note: There are few jump scares and one of them is fairly effective.

pros:
[list]
    [*]story
    [*]quality of graphics is adequate
[/list]

cons:
[list]
    [*]crashes and graphical corruption (like end of second level)
    [*]settings can be cropped preventing changes to them and they sometimes don't get saved
    [*]no remapping of controls
    [*]handling of mouse causes problems in lockpicking minigame
    [*]branches on ground in one level are nearly invisible (similar to pixel hunt in old adventure games)
[/list]

Due to too bad technical aspect (surprising as it uses Unity) get it only when on sale for cheap. (3â‚¬ is still bit too much)

review:
Ein sehr interessantes Spiel mit einer faszinierenden Story. Die AtmosphÃ¤re ist unsagbar gut aufgebaut; weniger Jump-Scares, dafÃ¼r aber ein intensives Grusel-GefÃ¼hl, welches einen die ganze Zeit begleitet.
Ãœberrascht haben mich die kleinen Besonderheiten des Spiels; abwechslungsreiche Kulissen, kleine Mini-Games und die fesselnde TiefgrÃ¼ndigkeit hinter den Szenen.

Ca. 2 Stunden Spielzeit, aber keine Sekunde davon bereut! Der Kauf hat sich definitiv gelohnt. 
FÃ¼r Horror-Einsteiger (wie ich es bin) kann ich es nur wÃ¤rmstens empfehlen. ^-^

review:
Ich kann dieses Spiel Ã¼berhaupt nicht empfehlen. Die Grafik war am Anfang ganz nett und Ich dachte da noch , das alles okay ist ,die SchulgÃ¤nge waren schlieÃŸlich gruselig genug , aber nach 10 Minuten wurde es richtig schrecklich. Die Aufgaben wurden immer einfacher und die Grafik nahm immer mehr ab.
Ich hatte aufgehÃ¶rt zu spielen , als ich mich umdrehte , sah einen Mann im HasenkostÃ¼m , der sich im Kreis dreht und auf einmal in den Himmel flog.

It's a 'horror' game with low budget that ends up being almost comedic and offensive in its themes at the same time.

Worth for $1. You can finish it in a couple hours with all achievements.

Has cheap jumpscares and loud screams at the beginning, becomes more refined halfway through but don't expect no AAA value or replayability at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1507677866}
review:
Tags: 1PHWS - First P. Horror Walk Sim
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: This is a Unity Engine high school shooter narrative with slow to build plot that is not respectful of player's time. Features quite a bit of pointless QTE, limited your FOV with tiny flashlight, sending you on easter egg hunts for an item, and trapping you in rooms until scripting allows you to leave.

The editing job on the multiple sequences allow for environment recycling that is actually narratively consistent so I can give it a pass for that. However the game features quite a few scenes where the lighting effects do not appropriately cloud the other character's models and you can clearly see that they are heavily untextured. The game features jumpscares that were also untextured.

Conclusion: You get about 3 hours of dragged out content that feels like it could had been stipped down to a much more solid 40 minutes experience. For that reason alone I am tempted to discard it. But on the other hand, the game did not frustrate progress to the point where I got stuck, the buildup for the protagonist's background and the shootout actually feels half credible. On the other hand, anything dialogue related was atrocious, seemingly mostly because of poor translation. The game did not really do a good job of establishing a connection between the player, the protag and the game universe.

review:
So, this "game" is absolutely awfull.

Basically, the execution is so poor, and storyline and gameplay so lame that it is even painfull to go through.
You are following the life of a nerd, shy and insecure student rejected by everybody, including his parents. He feels like a looser. 

This game deserves a 2/10. 1 point because the concept is interesting, 1 point for some interesting aspects.
- Do not buy this game
- Get it if you like to be tortured
- Get it if you want achievements

Reasons not to get it:

- Poor and cringe storyline
- Crap execution
- Walking simulator where you have to wait for custcenes and press buttons (WASDF and spacebar)
- Not fun to play
- Free DRM music
- Bugs
- ... much more

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 1895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1531038800}
review:
Morphine had an interesting idea which was executed more than sub par. While it does at times give off a mild Donnie Darko vibe, it's mainly due to the stolen theme of an insae reappearing rabbit. The few jumscares this has aren't worth the horror title and the story outline is pretty basic at best.

I am aware this is a one man project and a Turkish game, but the translation wasn't proofread and some of the English wording is cringe-worthy. Playing it in its native language, the writing is a lot better, but the general public cannot be expected to actually know how to read Turkish, so it remains a negative point.

The only redeeming feature is the actual topic of the story, yet the presentation is sadly completely unable to make it possible to receive the game seriously.

Even at 3$, this is no recommendation due to cringeworthy translation, cringeworthy animations, very basic presentation and a rather short experience of 2 hours maximum for a playthrough. (Accidentally forgot the tab open over night)

Die Grafik ist mehr als unansehnlich. Die Animationen, wenn man Ã¼berhaupt von welchen sprechen kann, sind grausam. Die Handlung mag einen ernsten Hintergrund haben, aber sie wirkt unweigerlich komisch. Ebenso wie die Horrorelemente. Es spricht nicht fÃ¼r ein Horrorspiel, wenn man seine Stellen, an dem es versucht einen zu erschrecken oder Angst einzuflÃ¶sen, einfach nur komisch und zum Lachen findet. Allgemein ist es kein gutes Zeichen fÃ¼r ein Spiel, wenn man sich schon nach kurzer Zeit wÃ¼nscht, dass es endlich enden mÃ¶ge, nach jeder weiteren Szene aufseufzt und man sich nur noch durchquÃ¤lt, um ans Ende zu kommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198342185277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1516165652}
review: This game is an atrocity. The few times voice acting is put in the game are the most headache inducing sounds. You can hear the fake crying, nonsensical whispering (which i will touch on in a sec), and boring shrieks and say to yourself, "Boy, if I didn't hate myself earlier, I sure do now for buying this game! Thanks, Morphine!" The effects of it are awful. When you're in the rain, you can't see shit. When you start running through fire, you get vertigo. When you move the fucking mouse you feel your brain leaving your head, coming back in, and getting whiplash. The horror aspect of this is nonexistent. The whispering (as I mentioned before) is annoying and wouldn't be unsettling to my cat. The jump scares are always accompanied by a loud scream that isn't scary at all and makes you want to stop playing. the writing is the worst part. At one point, the main character is referred to as Peter and your antagonist is named Ted. Simple enough, yes? But no. towards the end of the game, the names switch. For no reason. Throughout the game, your sad, miserable character has one friend named Jane. She is never introduced and is never acknowledged more than twice. Then she just stops existing around the same point that the names are switched. The characters are written to guilt you, but the main character was so pitiful I couldn't pity him. In fact, I wanted him to fuck off and go ride his asshole on a shotgun. Throughout the game, the protagonist is bullied and shit on constantly and the second this showed, I knew this would lead to a school shooting. And what happened? A school shooting. I should get some lottery tickets. Then the main character turned out to be Ted Bundy or something????? I don't know anymore. Part of me thinks it was all a fever dream.  The grammar is god awful, but I was willing to let it slide. This game was confusing, stupid, boring, and predictable. By the end of it, the only thing that made sense was the name because I wanted -- no -- NEEDED to take pain killers for the fucking migraine it gave me. This game gave me diseases, don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324907767', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1506743241}
review:
If you are a fan of Mr. Kumbasar's work (which to my knowledge is only this game) then you'll be like, "So f*cking prom!". That you will also write an intelligent review such as this remarkable one and while on the subject of intelligence. The moving message that Mr. Kumbasar's work invokes may take some time to fully deconstruct and may take years to fully digest. Because this "story", I'm putting it in quotation marks because it's much more than a story as expressed in the final lines in which Mr. Kumbasar says, "Although it is not based on an experienced story, it is a game based on experienced feelings". Which we all know is the reason why it's more than just a "story".                                                                                                  

-Thanks for the meme Kerim, and keep meme-ing and NEVER stop dreaming.

A student relives their tortured life up through high-school and does so while 'Donnie Darko' plays just off camera.  This first person horror game relies heavily on loud noises and jump scare to add stress to the player, but the limited animations and poor writing creates a comical situation instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023091277', 'num_games_owned': 3358, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1498526991}
review:
So I played this game through and decided to judge after having completed the game's storyline.

I understand the story and what the creator is trying to show us, but the execution is very poorly done. Which is unfortunate.  The grammar was painful to deal with while it's something that CAN be overlooked it plays a huge part in how your game is recieved by players.

It feels like the creator did not double check a lot of things, stuff became confusing for example the name changes between the main char and the other char it's about. (I don't want to spoil things for people who intend on playing this game). It's very confusing at least. 

Some of the interactions are insanely wonky and early on in the game I feel it's just crated with some cheap jumpscares that to me personally made NO sense at all. It felt to me like they were just there to startle you and were not related to the game itself at all.

Onto the 'cinematic' part of this game, unfortunately they are tedious. Dragged out and insanely slowgoing, making me wish I could skip them.  Something is not cinematic if you're staring at the same screen for 5 minutes, just to read some poorly formulated conversation between two people for it then to move on to something else.

I gave this game a shot, it's something that was a GREAT idea. If only the execution was a little better then this review would have been a positive one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993630261', 'num_games_owned': 1951, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1496634644}
review:
It's a short, intensive, creative game with a serious topic. It let you experience how bullying feels for a victim. The scenes in the game provokes a light psychotic, surrealistic, creepy feeling. 
Behind the development is a man from Turkey: Kerim Kumbasar (go check him out).

author: {'steamid': '76561197982293787', 'num_games_owned': 2327, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1498304412}
review: I'm always interested when games try to tackle difficult subjects. This attempt, however, is bad all around. The story and writing are both bad fundamentally. The game is plagued by performance issues and other bugs. For example if the game takes contorl away from your mouse, you can't use hte mouse in the menu system etiher! The story tries to be clever, but is nothig but tropes you've seen before, executed poorly. The script wasn't even run through a spell checker. This is a very missable game. I don't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994971393', 'num_games_owned': 2927, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1496528556}
review: A dark and surreal vignette (which is to say, quite short). More a piece of interactive fiction than a game. For english language players, the game is not natively written in english, and there are quite a few translation issues. Otherwise, the game is passably interesting. It has some good atmosphere, and some inventive transitions between scenes. The plot is rather heavy handed, but it does a good enough job of putting you in the place of a bullied kid to hate the bullies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986360343', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 866, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1496519175}
review:
Morphine puts us in the shoes of an 18-year-old high school student who experiences a lot of bullying in his class. I think the idea of putting school bullying in the focus is commendable as not many video game use it for storytelling purposes. It should also be noted that it was mainly developed by Kerim Kumbasar - upon completion you can read his notes saying the game is based on his own experience. 

Now, Morphine is, first and foremost, one of those first person exploration games. It is not an FPS in its true sense as shooting enemies is kept to a minimum. It is more about walking, interacting with objects and minimalistic puzzle solving. We relive the many times Peter was bullied by his classmate, Ted and these are often followed by dream-like sequences with a giant rabbit that is akin to the one in the film Donnie Darko. The main jumpscares are attributed to the appearance of this otherworldly creature.

My problem with Morphine was how it is executed. Not all the actions you do make sense and I felt it was unoptimised. I experienced severe FPS drops in an area where I could turn on the TV. Notes in the game help us understand what we experience - Peter describes in detail what Ted did to him. The problem here is the command of English employed which is just terrible. The game's synopsis on the store page is also full of spelling errors. I do not understand why no spellchecking was done right after the development activities were finalised. There's even a name change we experience towards the ending - it is unclear who you punish as throughout the game that particular person had a completely different name. 

Considering the high degree of oversight the game has I am inclined to downvote it. I am happy to have played a game with an interesting idea (finally something that doesn't just use Unity assets but actually employs a story), however, I cannot forgive the mistakes that could have easily been eliminated with a little more attention to detail. The version number remains 1.0 in the game menu which means the developer probably abandoned his project following the Steam release.

Perhaps the idea here was to test his programming skills; Kerim, for me, looks like an ambitious developer but this game still requires several updates to come to fruition. The many positives reviews do not help, either, as they often lack detailing the game experience or have similar punctuation / grammatical errors that prove they either received a free key or they are just friends of Kerim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290913643', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1496262447}
review:
I didn't know it was a terror game until I started playing it. I thought it was about the present of your life as a person bullied by people or that feels alone or something like that (due to that in the description it says "story based on experienced emotions") and that's what made me buy the game, because I really wanna know how people actually feels. But nah...it is only about a stupid bunny that first, scares you, tries to ruin your life and starts laughing at you after that, a boy with glasses that sees the space at a school corridor and a school girl that looks like the exorcism girl, anyways, I think it is still about "emotions".

In conclusion, the game is actually good.

If I talk about it more, it is just going to be a spoiler.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139328230', 'num_games_owned': 2324, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1485625722}
review:
[i]Morphine[/i] is the first and only game made by Kerem Kumbasar - a name that we see in nearly every available space of this game - a Turkish indie developer. For a one man project and a first trial at unity to produce something presentable, I'd say that it is a semi-success. The game has some imaginative value and is brave enough to take the risk of undergoing a psychedelic horror display, but it has its unforgivable parts which led me into casting a downvote.

To arrange a non-spoiler summary, our character is a high school student with some background and popularity issues. He is the subject of constant bullying for his whole high school experience, because why not? He is insecure and intolerant, with an impending psychosis on the side. The game invites us to go through a psychedelic journey in his memories, eventually bringing us to the point where he decides to get violent. It should be noted that the name of our protagonist is a bit ambiguous, since the names of our protagonist and antagonist got mixed-up half-way through the game. For the most part, he is referred as Peter - the bully being Ted, yet nearing the end game, our silent nerd is called as Ted and the bully is called as Peter. It is quite frustrating. It might be declared that they were the same and the one person altogether, but that really doesn't fit into the story, so... if anyone managed to get that part, inform me.

This next paragraph may contain some spoilers, so feel free to skip. To declare the cold, harsh truth: this is not really a horror game. As a character, our protagonist doesn't carry that much depth. The sentence "I'm not a loser" pops up everywhere to the degree of desensitizing you to his case. Sure he is deeply hurt and deeply disturbed to the point of hallucinating about on-going affairs. He especially keeps hallucinating about a body-builder anthropomorphic rabbit, which dreadfully resembles Frank from the movie [i]Donnie Darko[/i]. It's only pink and seems to be especially sadistic rather than existentialistic. He constantly teases and mocks the character in some disturbing, yet mostly comical scenes. The substance that gives the name to the title is more or less irrelevant to the whole context. At some point, our character injects himself with morphine, then goes wild enough to pull a school shooting. Now, that is plain misinformation. Morphine is an opiate. It is injected to deal with pain and it is highly addictive. It most certainly doesn't induce hallucinations, neither elevates aggression. On the contrary, it simply makes you high, and mostly docile.

Environment display is quite alright, and effects are okay, if not a bit overused. Jump scares mostly don't serve their purpose, yet they invoke a smile of ridicule on your face. That friggin' bunny is everywhere, and you'll get bored of him 10 minutes into the game. Character models seem somewhat decent, but nothing extraordinary. Remember that this is a unity game, and unity has always its limits.

Gameplay, even though somewhat basic and boring, works alright. No bugs, no system crashes etc. It mostly consists of WASD movement, some item picking and some mini-games. Considering that you cannot actually die, or lose the game, there is no real threat to the character either. So I'd hardly classify this game as a horror. Mini-games consist of some lock picking - similar to Skyrim lock picking -, some very rare QTEs and some dreadfully basic shooting. Other than that, you walk around, led by some eerie green glitter and keep reading journals with really, really poor English. Now I've seen some games with really bad translation, but here, it comes to the degree of actually crippling the plot. If only the developer would take a moment to make someone proofread the translation, we'd actually have a consistent plot here.

I most surely cannot recommend this game as it is, but if you are to acquire it in a bundle or a decent sale, you may still get some enjoyment out of it. It is really heartbreaking to see the potential getting crippled with huge display errors here. I wish the best for the lone cowboy developer and also wish him success for his next project.

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044857549', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1485646669}
review:
Watch the full review here - https://youtu.be/XTQPCrwmA-I

***Disclaimer: If you are looking for a serious game this is not for you*** 
Morphine is my favourite best-worst game to date. The entire experience feeds into the whole "It's so bad it's good!". Just imagine if The Room, or Fateful Findings could be a video game. Made by one dude who clearly was trying to express some pent up feelings, we have ended up with this really convoluted story about a boy being bullied. But this game is brilliant, like seriously! It's about bad translated English, it's about a strange attempt at horror, it's about not actually understanding how to real social interactions works. This is a game you buy, invite a friend over and play over a few beers. Please buy this game and support the dev so we can get more games like this!!!  I love a game that can actually make me laugh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011614558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1483437416}
review:
I am actually pleased to see this software is developed by only one man, but well, I really cannot consider it as a game. It is more like a story telling "thing", maybe telling some feeling about the author being bullied in school by the time he was young. Sort of like the experience about playing the game "The Paths". If you like such kind of game, this software might worth to buy during a price cut. It is hard for me to select the yes no buttons in the recommend section. Really only do recommend if it has a huge price cut, otherwise, better buy something else.

Pros:
Good imagination...
The art works are not bad.
Too short so that I can finish it quick.

Cons:
Too dark in some of the rooms.
Too much "I am not a loser".
The story is not fluent at all.
This is not really a game.
Too short.
Too slow.
Really cannot control the charactor most of the time. Like I want to try shooting everyone, but I cannot even aim, or like I want to shoot the bottles, but the bottles were shot in a weird way.
Make me think of the author was taking drugs while creating this software...

author: {'steamid': '76561198082959970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1479605716}
review:
This is an indie game, so if you are running for hughquality platformer games, run rabbut, run!
To look at the pro's and cons:
-Needs Polishing
-A little short
-The story

+Atmosphere
+Characters
+The story

Aboutthe story, it's great, but it could've been so much more..maybe some psychopathological details, I would've loved to see dissociative scenes, by specific sympotms of disorder, since Ted obviously had a traumatizing youth.
But for the price, 3 dollars, I definetly recommend this game, and I also recommend the producer to remaster it, expand it, maybe look for a studio to help you out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074428009', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1479634240}
review:
A depressive, psychotic FPS story about abusement and bullying.

Pros: 
 - acceptable graphics for an indie title
 - quite some ideas

Cons:
 - controls having some minor issues (like movement blocked by invisible things sometimes, sometimes it's not as easy to target and use object)
 - SERIOUS ISSUE is that from about the last quarter of the game, the protagonist's name is mixed up with the main negative character (Ted - Peter). Dear Developer, if you read this, please fix it! This is a serious issue regarding the game since it is story-based!
 - there are no voiceovers whatsoever, quite clumsy that mute people are talking and there are only subtitles


Anyway, worth the few cents as it was on sale. Otherwise.. not so sure. Still, I would recommend it.

review:
While you got to appreciate that this game was made by one single dude, probably no-budget, if fails to deliver due to its flaws: bad pacing and lacking polish. 

This starts good in a trashy, yet cool b-movie type way, but then just gets worse and worse until reaching a point where I couldn't force myself anymore to find out what's left to see. Huge kudos though for the off-mainstream subject and empathy-indulging, semi-psychological storyline.

review: The game could be all right but there is just so many stupid mistakes. English is my second language and I was like "how the **ck could he write it like that?". It looks that creator of the game didn't test it by himself properly, names are switched for the same characters during the game and it doesn't run very smoothly. Developer is showing his name everywhere like this was the best ****ing game ever, it is not. It is full of self pitty and the creator didn't even have to mention that he was bullied by himself, we can all feel it from the game how he tries to prove something to himself. And the end is long and boring like a coitus for a pro**itute during the work. Developer wants us to feel sorry for him, well I feel sorry for wasting my time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995498126', 'num_games_owned': 2373, 'num_reviews': 668, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1480450075}
review:
Ganz nett, aber erwartet nicht zu viel davon.

Ist ne kleine Geschichte fÃ¼r Zwischendurch. Dauert nicht lange, vielleicht 1-2 Stunden.
Man muss bis auf ein paar Dinge relativ wenig tun, eigentlich treibt man so nur die Story an.
Ein paar kleine Scary Moments sind dabei, aber es passiert einem ja nichts. 
Technisch insgesamt durchwachsen, die Steuerung ist eher mau, manchmal hakts ein wenig, einmal bin ich aus dem Level nach unten gefallen.
Das Spiel speichert automatisch an festen Checkpoints, im Prinzip kann man das Spiel auch in Eins durchzocken.
Die Steam Achievements sind ganz nett und machbar, man muss dazu noch einen 2ten Durchgang machen.
Wie gesagt, alles in allem nette Unterhaltung fÃ¼r Zwischendurch.
Wer nicht zu viel erwartet, kann es in einem Indie Bundle oder gÃ¼nstig im Deal mal ruhig mitnehmen und spielen.

Wertung: 6 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197998056243', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1474239097}
review:
Let me begin by saying that this is one of the worst indie games I have ever played. I am glad they lowered the price. It used to be 10 euros (or more), now it is 'only' 3 euros. I don't remember what I paid for it, but it was too much in any case.

The game treats important adolescence matters in a very superficial and stereotyped way. It lacks poetry and narration. There is no voice acting so you are staring at subtitles, which are horrendously full of syntax, grammar and spelling mistakes (can't speak for the Turkish version, I played with English subs). Animations are practically absent. Hell, the developer even switched the protagonist and antagonist's names, at the end of the game.

This game is not a tribute to Donnie Darko, it is an insult. It takes something from Carrie as well. It's a mixture of failure and ignorance, I really don't know what the developer wanted to communicate, but whatever it was, he failed miserably.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027588319', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1474201121}
review:
Terrible Game

-Kerim Kumbasar everywhere, I get it. You are proud of your game.
-Overly used Screen Effect where it doesn't make any sense
-Lots of Bug
-This is no Horror
-Jumpscare with the jumpscare sfx and camera doesn't sync if you keep on moving your mouse during cinematics. Making the jumpscare a jumplaugh

+Graphic is nice atleast

I tried to give it a chance, play it as far as it will let me. Upon reaching a certain point where the ugly rabbit pushes me off to the abbys, the game crash. I will never run this crap again. The moment it crash is the moment I uninstall the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100199344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1448911952}
review:
Ein Spiel das definitiv Wert ist gespielt zu werden!
Morphine ist ein emotional packendes game mit einem gewissen Horror touch ,dass einige Eastereggs bezÃ¼glich dem herrausragenden Film "Donnie Darko" beinhaltet. Es nimmt ein gesellschaftliches oft vorhandenes Problem auf und verarbeitet es in eine ziemlich interessante Geschichte die davon nicht abneigt mit den Hirn eines jeweiligen Gamers zu spielen ;D

Definitive Kaufempfehlung
7,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045671367', 'num_games_owned': 3048, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1508406734}
review:
This game has not much to do with Morphine. 

It's a story told about a guy who gets bullied at school and isn't welcome and gets ridiculed at home. 

You play him and experience different stages in his life. 

The game is overall not very good. It is very simple and the graphics are okay, the story is okay too. There are many mistakes in the texts but it's all understandable. 

Overall i would not recommend the game, except you want easy achievements. 

0/10

review:
La idea fue buena, la historia tambien, la ambientacion esta buena, la musica, el conejo, sangre en los muros, obscuridad, pero tiene graficos malos, se puede mejorar, pero por ahora no vale la pena gastar un solo peso en el juego hasta que tenga mejoras. A demas, gasta muchos recursos en pcs medios.- 
- No tiene opciones, solo las tiene para arreglar graficos y nada mas.-
- La sensibilidad del mouse es asquerosa, demasiado sensible, no hay opciones para configurar.-
- 
2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197986406741', 'num_games_owned': 3234, 'num_reviews': 913, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1469379991}
review:
This was a horrible experience to endure for almost a hour and a half. While the idea of exposing bullying in schools is okay.. the technical aspects of the game are really really uninspired. Ugly textures, bad colours for the eyes, annoying camera and unfit fonts make for a really really really BAD game. Unity Personal Edition.. 3 euros for this? Poor developer profiting of the bullying phenomenon..

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oZCHq3k2oIM

review:
TL;DR- I can't play it without a mouse invert option.

Pros: The video of it looks great.  I think it will be fun to play.  I think it has great potential.

Cons: I'm afraid I can't play it without knowing what keys to use and most importantly I need mouse invert.  

If key binding and mouse options are added, I'll revisit and try playing again.  Hopefully then I will change it from not recommended to recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046017263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1467517979}
review:
This game is a mess. 
-English is terrible
-Pacing is really slow in several spots
-Final level the names of the protagonist and antagonist are reversed
-Epilogue just recaps Climax and adds nothing

However, I believe everyone should play this game. Morphine is to gaming as The Room is to movies. It is terrible, but needs to be experienced to make the world a better place.

Also it is not a horror game. It has 2 jump-scares but I think they are mostly there because the author didn't know how to transition between scenes for the first half of the game.

Play this game for Engrish-fun and you'll love it.  As a scary game, it's garbage.  Got this as part of a $2 bundle and enjoyed it for at least $3 worth.

+ Written by someone with a loose understanding of English
+ Decent enough quality
+ Unintentional comedy value through the roof!
- Stupid story line
- Not scary at all

author: {'steamid': '76561197977715813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1465839671}
review:
I really tried to like this game. I appreciate the work of the developer, and I think the subject of the game is important. However there are just too many shortcomings in the game to recommend it, even for an indie game.

First, the graphics: Most of the scenes are very dark, and you either look for dark gray objects on a darker gray ground, or try to find your way using a absurdly small cone of light coming from your mobile or a flashlight. And even if there is a little more light, graphic is simple and static.

The story: As I said earlier, the subject is important, but why must the story be so shallow-brained? Poor kid is left by his mom, despised by his dad, bullied by his classmates, whatever could happen to a kid, he got it. Locked in the barn, thrown in the water and his mother even bothers to write a letter how much she hates him before she leaves. Oh, come on.

The gameplay: ItÂ´s simply bland. The game would make a nice walking simulator, as most of the time all you have to do is walk around, find the right (and very often only) hotspot in the room and click it - if it wasnÂ´t so dark! Very often you walk through a dark grey coridor looking for a medium gray object on a darker gray ground. Also, there are these terrible "minigames" - like when you tap space again and again and again to break open a door - and these completely useless puzzles: [spoiler] You face a locked door - you find a pickaxe - when you try to break open the door, the pickaxe is stuck in the wood and you cannot pull it out again. [/spoiler] Seriously?
What makes it worse - some hotspots are activated only after you interacted with another item, so you have to click in the order A-B-C and nothing else.
There are no decisions to make, the path is set and all you can do is follow it.

So again, as much as I tried to like the game - I completed it and all achievements - in the end the question is: Is it a good game? And the answer sadly is no. No doubt. ItÂ´s not. Not at all.
Dont waste your money!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042052301', 'num_games_owned': 3073, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1465427373}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075000581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1465245912}
review:
I really enjoyed this game, although toward the end it started to freeze a lot and could do with an update for that reason. The english is not great it but it's not the most important thing. The suspense of the game actually over rides a lot of it's faults making it more enjoyable. 

The only thing I found was that at the end of the game, the names of the lead characters switch over, I think this was a mistake because there isn't any explanation to suggest it was supposed to be that way. I think that's a real shame because otherwise it's a nice game.

If it gets an update to fix those issues it will be great, but I'd still recommend it either way. Made me jump a few times!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037572211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1485969730}
review:
This game has developed from fun horror to comedy then to absolute bullshit that I was very annoyed and only playing for the achievements. Until it started making more sense in the end. And I must admit, I'm pretty impressed! An unpredictable game is always a favorite.

I agree the game is broken and needs A LOT of polishing on so many levels, from performance to animation and broken English which made the game pretty dull, but let's not forget this is a work of an independent developer. And for a first project this was quite impressive. So let's not play games for what we expect but for what they have to offer. Because I'm very picky when it comes to graphics and performance yet I was able to enjoy this game which made it very easy for me to ignore its flaws and not many games can do that.

Dear Kerim Kumbasar your message touched me and will keep spinning in my head for a while <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198006541362', 'num_games_owned': 2760, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1461338528}
review:
A 18 yo student is constantly bullied at school and starts finding solace in a fantastical world that slowly mixes with reality.
Don't get fooled by this premise though, sadly the actual game is as mind-numbing as an actual dose of morphine due to its amateurish narrative and slow pacing.

[b]PROS:[/b]

-nothing really

[b]NEUTRAL:[/b]

-the graphics aren't too bad but suffer due to some annoying effects and wooden animations

[b]CONS:[/b]

-dull story, amateurish narrative, terrible dialogues 

-drawn out cutscenes 

-clumsy jump scares

-minigames feel out of place

-uninspired puzzles 

-terrible English translation

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=670595302

Morphine feels, simply put, like an uninteresting and dull chore as you play through it. The gameplay consists of simply walking around, picking up diary pages and going through cutscenes with a few minigames or puzzles thrown around (lockpicking, making a campfire, opening certain dorrs or, sigh, fishing). Said puzzles and minigames are uninspired at best and can sometimes become annoying due to being set in dimply lit places or requiring you to find small objects in a certain room. 

But the story and pacing are the main culprits here, seldom have I played something so tedious. Dialogues are cliched, slow (no voice acting and there's several seconds between lines) and basically all revolve around the fact that people at school are bad. Even cutscenes suffer from the same problem as they're filled with moments where nothing happens or your attention is drawn for several unnecessary seconds over certain things in the area. Heck even after you finish the game there's a small credits screen and then you're forced to go through several more minutes of cutscenes basically recapping what just happened, why? why would you do that?  The stumbling English just makes things even worse and can sometimes also get in the way of a puzzle (like calling a safety pin "a buckle" or small branches being referred to as "bushes". Even if you discount the aforementioned problems the story is uninteresting at best, leaves no lasting impression and can at times just feel a bit pretentious.

Unless you desperately need to get rid of that insomnia that's been bothering you I can't recommend this one: horror games are a dime a dozen nowadays and Morphine is subpar both in story and gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016575530', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1460839607}
review:
Kerim Kumbasar. This is something that is spinning in my head after playing 5 hours of this.

Could have been a really good game. I like the concept, the atmosphere, the story seemed a bit interesting but... Let's summarise:

Pros:
-If you have a good imagination, it can become a good game (in your head)
-The refund in Steam works

Cons:
-Kerim Kumbasar everywhere (ok, I get it. It's your game and I won't steal it!)
-Terrible bugs just before the jumpscares
-The jumpscare screams almost f*** up my speakers with the high pitch and the low quality of sound
-Options menu - 404 not found
-Graphics are somehow ok but the settings are total crap (I had to play it in Low Preset on my Alienware)
-Get stuck at some points and then you have to restart at the last checkpoint
-The dialogues? Thank you Mr Google Translate!!
-Did I mention Kerim? 

In my account I have all sorts of crap games. I never requested a refund. I paid for this less than a Euro but I want my money back.

La ambientaciÃ³n es buena, y la trama toca temas de Bulling y de mentes rotas. La historia es bastante tÃ­pica y normalita. El juego da bandazos entre el terror en los primeros compases y los recuerdos normales de su vida la mayorÃ­a del rato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049701098', 'num_games_owned': 3699, 'num_reviews': 832, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1454849626}
review:
Morphine is a (mostly) first person psychedelic horror adventure title that puts you in the shoes of Ted Bundy. No, not THAT Ted Bundy, but it's worth assuming that the protagonist was not given this name perchance. The decision of the name is quite misleading, as Ted Bundy assaulted and murdered women exclusively; the Ted in this game does not. With that said, I feel as though this game is a combination of inspiration taken directly from Donnie Darko, and the Columbine Massacre.

Ted is a student in high school, and it quickly becomes clear that he is the victim of what many of us have experienced at one time or another in our lives, bullying. Not only is he bullied by a student named Peter, but Ted's father also deems him to be a failure for not being able to shoot a gun, swim, or fish; you know, the typical "manly" survival aspects of life. The player will relive many of the decisive moments of Ted's life, and will be able to read more into the inner thoughts of the character through journal pages.

Morphine is made in Unity. Now that your skin has finished crawling, I will continue to say that while the game's performance isn't abysmal like many other Unity titles, there are frame drop issues and a lack of any sort of control configure system. However, on a positive note there are no glitches or crashes that deem the game unplayable. It should also be noted here that the original dialogue is in Turkish, and has been poorly translated to English; the amount of grammatical errors to be found are innumerable, and sometimes they lead to confusion of the main plot. However, the way the game performs overall is decent seeing as the entire thing was made by one person.

Now, I've never personally heard of Morphine causing anyone to go insane with rage and kill a bunch of people. I'm not entirely sure why the developer decided to make this the title drug of choice. The plot is weak, and Ted ends almost every single journal entry by saying "I am not a loser!". I understand that this game is based on the emotions that the developer went through during his time in school, and I understand them well; I too was bullied quite a lot. The self-loathing, awkwardness, social distance, and overwhelming depression are emotions all too familiar to me. Although these emotions are mostly conveyed through journal entries, I couldn't help but feel that Ted was an overall weak character. Despite his rage "building" towards the end, he comes off as more of a sad-sack than someone seeking revenge.

As far as horror titles go, Morphine is just okay. It tries hard in the beginning to scare you, and may even succeed with a few jump scares. However, towards the middle and end of the game, the horror aspect has been left far behind in lieu of the true plot and flashbacks regarding why Ted is reaching his breaking point. The game lasts about 2 hours for one playthrough, and unless you're going back for some achievements I sincerely doubt anyone will go back for a second run. There are far, far better horror titles on Steam; be they indie or otherwise. If you get it in a bundle, cool, otherwise don't waste your time.

[h1]Rating: [b]2.0/5.0[/b] - It's not awful, but it's not great.[/h1]

review:
[h1]Just not that good[/h1]

at this point I dont think I can even finish the game. The visuals are subpar, the story is mediocre at best, the gameplay it jittery, and worst of all the only horror aspect is a collection of jump scares. The camping chapter is annoying and involves to much collecting. The are actually parts in the maps where the scenery doesn't fit together. Not the worst game ever and for price I bought it for I guess I shouldn't complain, but I wish I had my $3.00 back. If you are thinking about buying this game think twice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025812458', 'num_games_owned': 1991, 'num_reviews': 445, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1483048347}
review:
I was so interested in this game based on the screenshots and the obvious inspiration drawn from Donnie Darko. After playing it though, I became more interested in trying out the new steam refund policy. This game is absolutely fucking nonsense. There are some interesting artistic ideas here but everything about this is just shit. A 3 year old could've made a better English translation for a game. The gameplay elements are clunky as hell. The story is just the most mindless rubbish on steam. I was worried this game would be hipster jerk off material, wearing its inspirations on its sleeve. I thought it would be incomplete or have bad presentation. It's all that and worse. Don't even bother. 

3/10

review:
Herkese selam 
Oncelikle bahsetmek isterimki oyunu fiyatina gore incelemek lazim yani gidip cok kisa demek olmaz incelemeden once bunu belirtmek istedim neyse incelemeye gecelim
Once senaryodan bahsedicem eger bu senaryo kerime aitse onu tebrik ederim senaryo hos olmus tahmin edilebilir ama cekici ve empati kurduruyor 
Oynanis zaten fps korku oyunu oldugu icin pek bisey soyliye
mem ama sizi farkli ortamlarda etkilesime soktugu icin hosuma gitti
Oynanis suresi uzun degil ama doyurucu yani sadece okulda gecmiyor
Grafiklerde guzel hele isiklandirmalar harika olmus ama yuz midellemelerini pek begenmedim fiyatina gire oda iyi gerci seslendirmelerde iyiydi.sasirtici derecede en cok begendigim su modellemesiydi 
Ozet olarak oyun guzel alip oynanmali bu oyunu 1 kisi gelistirdi sonucta ve onun turk olmasi bizi gururlandiriyor 
Eger oyunu bir  turk gelistirmis olmasaydi yine hosuma giderdi oyun 
Herkese selamlar

author: {'steamid': '76561198055362685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1446576680}
review:
Good story, very appealing to an ex-art student (me) who had to sit through films like Eraserhead for 'coursework' - Nothing is going to kill you or force you to reload a checkpoint, but there are some pretty good jumpscares, creepy ambience and interactive elements. It is really horror of an aquired taste though, so if FNAF or Slenderman scares you, this probably won't be your cup of tea.

The only downside I have is with the dialogue (written). While it is easy to get the jist of the narration, a lot of the english is broken and could do with being proofread before being published. Normally it wouldn't bother me, but at certain moments, lack of grammar can ruin it a little.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024464180', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1446268758}
review:
Not entirely certain what to think here :/ I thought this was going to basically be a horror game played from the viewpoint of a school bully's victim and exploring the pschological suffering and terror that go along with it. Blah blah - fancy words, fancy expectations.

What I got was a bizarre mixture of overly loud scream effects, guiding faerie lights, and the Donnie Darko rabbit with a serious case of steroid abuse. I honestly feel that this could have actually been an awesome game with a bit of polishing. But sadly, the only thing this game is, is a hodgepodge attempt at artsyness wrapped in chaotic failure. Cheesey, badly executed and predictable horror effects have been sprinkled to and fro and inbetween the cookie cutter characters: your default douchebag bully, your default girl of your dreams, your default creepy creature, your default terrors, your default troubled nerd glasses kid... the list goes on. Oh, and just because: needless lockpick and door opening minigames. IMHO a game can be "wierd and artsy" but if it relies solely on that, the results end up being stale and somewhat cheap, as the story felt extremely flimsy and predictable here. 

And I feel bad saying all of this, because the idea and the concept of the game are quite neat. One other thing that really really bothered me was the atrocious english translation. One or two little mistakes can easily be ignored, but the game is saturared with bad expressions, faulty grammar, and flimsy translations. English is a difficult language to master - even more so when you're not a native speaker. But there are so, so, SO many people right here on Steam who would have been delighted to proof read it as well as help out with the grammar, spelling and what have you.

Blaaaaaaaargh. Not my cup of tea, for sure. I tried to like it and give it a chance. But I wish the dev good luck in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011760729', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1446136797}
review:
This time I'm not gonna be "official" neither I will do review in that style.

Simply, for 7.5 bucks you get narrative physiological triller with scary elements here and there. It's long approx 1.5 hours, made in Unity engine yet a bit more different with more passion and feelings involved while developing which can be noticed even by casual gamer who played a lot "unity" games.

Not sure are models in game custom made or bought, but atmosphere and concept of the story come before anything else so you dont really pay attention to that. 

Basically from story/atmosphere/concept side game is pretty good, really makes you feel different and leave you with hard impression after beating game. Although from technical side there are quite few cons and problems which might get some gamers not to like this title. No voice acting at all, not impressive graphics although I've seen much terrible titles in Unity engine khm khm Rake khm khm. So based on both concept and technical side I would summary this under positive impression.

Game is dark, describing bullied kid and his world through his eyes and unfortunately well-known outcome in most of the situations where same thing happen. There are scary jumps here and there but dont expect regular horror style at all.

As developer Kerim stated, game is not based on true experiance but its based on true feelings. Were you bullied in school or not I think that you are going to imagine yourself on Peter place while you play this game and its gonna make you think a bit how those kids/persons feel in that kind of situation.

Overall, good job ! Also good pricing and not going crazy since game is longer comparing to some others.

P.S I did recieved couple review copies, but this is completely my thought and impression. I usually record gameplay/short review and I end the game, this time I completed game all the way till end without rushing and I didnt realized that 90 minutes passed. So good job.
